In the digital age where tools shape the way we think and work, my software choices reflect precision, curiosity, and a focus on reproducible research. Every project I undertake is supported by a curated suite of tools that accelerate productivity and improve reliability. This page documents the ecosystem that powers my research, development, writing, teaching, and content creation.

# Machine Learning & AI Development

## Deep Learning Frameworks

- [**PyTorch**](https://pytorch.org/) – Primary framework for deep learning research and model development.
- [**TensorFlow**](https://www.tensorflow.org/) – Alternative framework for machine learning projects.
- [**PyTorch Lightning**](https://lightning.ai/docs/pytorch/stable/) – High-level framework for structured, scalable training on top of PyTorch.
- [**Hugging Face Transformers**](https://huggingface.co/transformers/) – Library for state-of-the-art transformer-based NLP models.

## Python Ecosystem

- [**Python 3.x**](https://www.python.org/) – Core programming language for ML, scripting, and automation.
- [**Jupyter Notebook**](https://jupyter.org/) – Interactive computational environment for experiments and prototypes.
- [**Google Colab**](https://colab.research.google.com/) – Cloud-based environment for Python and GPU-accelerated ML.

## Experiment Configuration & Versioning

- [**Hydra**](https://hydra.cc/) – Configuration framework for managing complex experiment setups.
- [**Data Version Control (DVC)**](https://dvc.org/) – Data version control and pipeline automation for ML projects.
- [**TensorBoard**](https://www.tensorflow.org/tensorboard) – Visualization toolkit for training metrics and model graphs.

# Development Environment

## Code Editors & IDEs

- [**Visual Studio Code (VS Code)**](https://code.visualstudio.com/) – Primary editor for coding, writing, and note-taking.
- [**RStudio**](https://posit.co/products/open-source/rstudio/) – Integrated development environment for R.
- [**Doom Emacs**](https://github.com/doomemacs/doomemacs) – Highly configurable Emacs configuration for advanced text editing.
- [**Notepad++**](https://notepad-plus-plus.org/) – Lightweight editor for quick text editing on Windows.

## Environment & Project Management

- [**Conda**](https://docs.conda.io/) / [**Micromamba**](https://mamba.readthedocs.io/en/latest/user_guide/micromamba.html) – Environment and package management for Python and data science.
- [**Lightning-Hydra Template**](https://github.com/ashleve/lightning-hydra-template) – Structured ML project template combining PyTorch Lightning, Hydra, and best practices.

## Terminal & Shell

- [**Windows Terminal**](https://learn.microsoft.com/windows/terminal/) – Modern terminal solution on Windows.
- [**PowerShell**](https://learn.microsoft.com/powershell/) – Scripting and task automation on Windows.
- [**Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL2)**](https://learn.microsoft.com/windows/wsl/) – Linux environment on Windows, primarily using Ubuntu.

# Research & Academic Writing

## Literature Management

- [**Zotero**](https://www.zotero.org/) + [**BetterBibTeX**](https://retorque.re/zotero-better-bibtex/) – Reference management, citation keys, and BibTeX/CSL JSON export.
- [**Google Scholar**](https://scholar.google.com/) – Literature search and citation tracking.
- [**ORCID**](https://orcid.org/), [**Scopus**](https://www.scopus.com/), [**ResearchGate**](https://www.researchgate.net/) – Researcher profiles and academic networking.

## Document Preparation

- [**Quarto**](https://quarto.org/) – Primary tool for presentations, reports, thesis chapters, and documentation.
- [**LaTeX**](https://www.latex-project.org/) – Typesetting for technical documents, including custom classes like `ManitThesis.cls` and MANIT Lab Manual.
- [**Pandoc**](https://pandoc.org/) – Universal document converter behind many of my workflows.
- **Markdown** – Lightweight markup language for notes and documentation.
- [**TinyTeX**](https://yihui.org/tinytex/) / `pdflatex` – Minimal TeX distribution and PDF generation tooling.

## Writing & Note-Taking

- [**VS Code**](https://code.visualstudio.com/) – Primary environment for writing Quarto/Markdown documents.
- [**Obsidian**](https://obsidian.md/) – Knowledge management and personal note-taking using Markdown.

## Diagramming & Graphics for Papers

- [**TikZ/PGF**](https://ctan.org/pkg/pgf) – LaTeX-based diagrams for high-quality figures.
- [**Mermaid**](https://mermaid.js.org/) – Text-based diagrams and flowcharts embedded in Markdown/Quarto.
- [**draw.io (diagrams.net)**](https://www.diagrams.net/) – Browser-based diagramming tool.
- [**Inkscape**](https://inkscape.org/) – Vector graphics editor for technical diagrams and figures.

# Statistical Computing with R

## Core R Stack

- [**R**](https://www.r-project.org/) – Statistical computing and data analysis.
- [**tidyverse**](https://www.tidyverse.org/) – Collection of R packages (e.g., `dplyr`, `ggplot2`, `tidyr`, `purrr`) for data science.
- [**rmarkdown**](https://rmarkdown.rstudio.com/) – Dynamic documents using R and Markdown.
- [**pagedown**](https://github.com/rstudio/pagedown) – HTML-based paged documents, including academic CVs.

## Typical Use Cases

- Automation for Systematic Literature Reviews (SLRs).
- CV generation via an Excel → R → pagedown pipeline.
- Statistical analysis, visualization, and reproducible reports.

# Data Visualization & Graphics

## Data Visualization Libraries

- [**Matplotlib**](https://matplotlib.org/) – Core plotting library for Python.
- [**Seaborn**](https://seaborn.pydata.org/) – Statistical data visualization built on top of Matplotlib.
- [**ggplot2**](https://ggplot2.tidyverse.org/) – Grammar of graphics implementation in R.
- [**Plotly**](https://plotly.com/) – Interactive graphing library for Python and R.
- [**Tableau**](https://www.tableau.com/) – Business intelligence and dashboarding.

## Image & Design Tools

- [**GIMP**](https://www.gimp.org/) – Raster graphics and photo editing.
- [**LibreOffice Draw**](https://www.libreoffice.org/discover/draw/) – Diagrams and sketches.
- [**Microsoft PowerPoint**](https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/powerpoint) – Slide design and visual content creation.

# High-Performance Computing

## Cluster & Remote Computing

- **Portable Batch System (PBS)** – Job scheduling on HPC clusters using commands like `qsub` and `qstat`.
- **SSH / SCP** – Remote server access and secure file transfer from the terminal.

## Monitoring & Hardware Tools

- `htop` – Interactive process and resource monitor in terminal.
- `nvidia-smi` – GPU monitoring and management for NVIDIA GPUs.

# Version Control & DevOps

- [**Git**](https://git-scm.com/) – Distributed version control system.
- [**GitHub**](https://github.com/) – Code hosting, issues, and collaboration.
- [**GitHub Actions**](https://github.com/features/actions) – CI/CD automation for testing, deployment, and Quarto publishing.
- [**Data Version Control (DVC)**](https://dvc.org/) – Dataset and model versioning, experiment tracking, and pipelines.

# Productivity & System Management

## System & Configuration Management

- [**Windows Package Manager (winget)**](https://learn.microsoft.com/windows/package-manager/) – Package manager for installing and updating software on Windows.
- [**chezmoi**](https://www.chezmoi.io/) – Cross-machine dotfiles management for consistent development environments.

## Productivity & Everyday Tools

- [**Raindrop.io**](https://raindrop.io/) – Bookmark and web resource manager.
- [**Microsoft Edge**](https://www.microsoft.com/edge) – Primary web browser.
- [**Espanso**](https://espanso.org/) – Cross-platform text expansion.
- [**Slack**](https://slack.com/) / [**Microsoft Teams**](https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-teams) – Communication and collaboration platforms.

## Cloud Storage

- [**Google Drive**](https://www.google.com/drive/) – Cloud storage, backup, and file sharing.

# Content Creation & Outreach

## Video & Screen Content

- [**OBS Studio**](https://obsproject.com/) – Screen recording and live streaming.
- [**Shotcut**](https://shotcut.org/) – Open-source video editor.
- [**YouTube Studio**](https://studio.youtube.com/) – Channel and content management for my *ResearchInfuser* YouTube channel.

# Office Suites

- [**LibreOffice**](https://www.libreoffice.org/) – Open-source office productivity suite.
- [**Microsoft 365 / Office Suite**](https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365) – Word, Excel, and PowerPoint (used when required).

# Automation & Scripting

- [**Google Apps Script**](https://developers.google.com/apps-script) – Automation for Google Workspace, including timetable generation and workflows.
- **Excel → R → pagedown pipeline** – Automated academic CV and document generation.
- **HTML / CSS / JavaScript** – Web content, UI tweaks, and lightweight automations.

## Contributing

These projects are open source and contributions are welcome. You can:

- Report issues or suggest improvements on GitHub.
- Submit pull requests with enhancements.
- Fork and adapt templates for your institution's requirements.
- Share your use cases and feedback to help improve future releases.

Most projects are licensed under permissive open-source licenses (typically MIT or GPL) to ensure reusability and benefit to the wider research community.
